cs691.assignment04

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs691.assignment04.Utils

  • public class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains utility methods that will be useful for several portions of this assignment. For those of you new to Java, they are static methods, meaning they belong to the class and not any specific object and that you can call them (from other places) using: Utils.computeProbs(...).
    Author:
    sloscal1

        public Utils()

    • Method Detail

      • computeProbs

        public static double[][] computeProbs(java.util.List<java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> clustering,
                                      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> classLabels)
        Compute the probability p_{i,j} - the probability that an instance in cluster j belongs to class i.
        Parameters:
        clustering - sets of ids representing cluster membership
        classLabels - contains the class labels of each element in the data (.get(id) returns instance at index id's class label). classLabels are assumed to be 0 .. number of class labels - 1.
        Returns:
        a matrix such that matrix[j][i] is the probability that an instance in cluster j belongs to class i.

      • entropy

        public static double entropy(double[] probabilities)
        Compute the entropy of an entity given an array of probability distributions with respect to class labels
        Parameters:
        probabilities - an array of p_{i,j} values, in this case, each index contains the probability of an element in this cluster belonging to class i.
        Returns:
        the entropy value

      • computeNormalizedMutualInformation

        public static double computeNormalizedMutualInformation(java.util.List<java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> clustering,
                                                        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> classLabels)
        Compute normalized mutual information according to the description on page 5 of http://www.aaai.org/Papers/ICML/2003/ICML03-027.pdf
        Parameters:
        clustering - sets of ids representing cluster membership
        classLabels - contains the class labels of each element in the data (.get(id) returns instance at index id's class label). classLabels are assumed to be 0 .. number of class labels - 1.
        Returns:
        the normalized mutual information for this clustering given the class labels

      • computeConditionalEntropy

        public static double computeConditionalEntropy(java.util.List<java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> clustering,
                                               java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> classLabels)
        Compute conditional entropy according to the description on page 5 of http://www.aaai.org/Papers/ICML/2003/ICML03-027.pdf
        Parameters:
        clustering - sets of ids representing cluster membership
        classLabels - contains the class labels of each element in the data (.get(id) returns instance at index id's class label). classLabels are assumed to be 0 .. number of class labels - 1.
        Returns:
        the conditional entropy for this clustering given the class labels

      • getClustering

        public static java.util.List<java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> getClustering(weka.clusterers.Clusterer clusterer,
                                                                             weka.core.Instances data)
                                                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Given a constructed Clusterer object (like EM) and a set of instances, return a list of sets of indices where each set represents a cluster, and the indices are with respect to the given data object.
        Parameters:
        clusterer - a pre-built clustering algorithm (i.e., buildClusterer has already been called)
        data - a non-null set of instances
        Returns:
        the cluster member ship of all instances in data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - could be thrown if the clusterer does not handle the instance or is not built.

      • extractClassLabels

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> extractClassLabels(weka.core.Instances data)
        Creates a list of integers representing the class labels of the data, the list has the same number of entries as instances in data. Unlike the class labels in data, the labels the returned list are integers from 0 .. num unique class labels. This method allows easier indexing in some of the evaluation methods.
        Parameters:
        data - must be non-null
        Returns:
        a list of integers representing the class label for each instance in data, or null if the data does not have an attribute named "class".

      • removeClassLabel

        public static weka.core.Instances removeClassLabel(weka.core.Instances data)
        Create a new Instances object that is identical to data except the class attribute (if it exists in data) has been removed from the returned object.
        Parameters:
        data - non-null
        Returns:
        a new Instances object as described above

      • computeBIC

        public static double computeBIC(weka.core.Instances data,
                                weka.clusterers.EM clusterer)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the Bayesian Information Criterion (BIC) given this data and an EM clusterer (that has already been built). Use http://www.aladdin.cs.cmu.edu/papers/pdfs/y2000/xmeans.pdf Section 3.2 to complete this implementation (wikipedia has too high a level discussion on BIC to implement it, but it may help understand what it is doing).
        Parameters:
        data - non-null
        clusterer - already built
        Returns:
        the BIC expressing how likely this data is given the model subject to some mild model complexity penalty
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - don't worry about throwing exceptions... if shouldn't happen if the input is right.
